snippet: The attacks on American and European diplomatic posts in recent weeks have roused calls for disengagement from the Arab world.
abstract: Arab leaders press hard for a greater American role in toppling Syrian Pres Bashar al-Assad, but looming over any potential intervention is the specter of Iraq, where a sectarian civil war devastated the country in 2006 and 2007 despite American military presence; protests in the Middle East over video mocking the Prophet Muhammad also add to doubts about the effectiveness of an intervention in Syria.

byline.original: By ROBERT F. WORTH and HELENE COOPER
byline.contributor: Robert F. Worth reported from Doha, and Helene Cooper from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The attacks on American and European diplomatic posts in recent weeks have roused calls for disengagement from the Arab world.

headline.seo: Mideast Turmoil Heats Up Debate on U.S. Intervening in Syria
headline.main: Mideast Unrest Intensifies Debate on U.S. Intervention in Syria
headline.print_headline: Mideast Unrest Intensifies Debate on U.S. Intervention in Syria

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
